items.title: Shares of Shriram Finance rise on Jefferies’ Buy call over promising growth prospects
items.description: Jefferies is optimistic about the company’s growth prospects, particularly in the used passenger vehicle (PV) and non-auto segments, which should help drive a 17 percent compound annual growth rate (CAGR) in assets under management (AUM) over FY25-27. This growth is expected to offset some of the pressures from the weak CV market.

items.title: M&M shares rise 3% to extend gains for a second day after bullish brokerage calls
items.description: The rebound in M&M shares comes after a sharp fall the previous week when it clocked its biggest single-day fall in nearly 7 months  on February 21. The sentiment in domestic auto majors took a hit on worries of impact of Elon Musk-led Tesla's entry into India.

items.title: Nestle India shares rise on plans to consider a price hike to offset costlier inputs
items.description: "Wherever (price increase) is absolutely essential, we will have to take some pricing action," Nestle India Managing Director Suresh Narayanan said on February 24, adding the price hike will be ‘as low as possible’.

items.title: 360 ONE WAM rises 4% on upbeat projection by brokerages after B&K acquisition
items.description: Citi has maintained a Buy with target of Rs 1275 per share, and said that equity broking revenue could grow by as much as 15-20 percent over next three years, with B&K contributing around 75 percent to this growth.

items.title: IREDA shares jump 4% as shareholders approve to raise up to Rs 5,000 crore via QIP
items.description: IREDA's Rs 5,000 crore fundraising will take place in one or multiple tranches and includes dilution of the government's stake by up to 7 percent post-issue

items.title: Stocks to Watch: UPL, SBI, ONGC, NTPC in focus on 25 February
items.description: Today, several major stocks are in focus, including UPL, SBI Life Insurance, ONGC, NTPC, and Shree Cement. UPL announced a significant investment of $53.85 million by its subsidiary, UPL Holdings Brazil, increasing its stake in Sinova Inovações Agrícolas S.A. to 49.97%. SBI Life Insurance appointed Dorababu Daparti as its new Deputy CEO to strengthen its leadership. Meanwhile, ONGC will invest Rs 1,200 crore in ONGC Green (OGL) through a rights issue to acquire a 100% stake in PTC Energy, marking a move towards green energy. NTPC and its subsidiary NTPC Green Energy signed MoUs with the Madhya Pradesh government for over Rs 2 lakh crore in renewable energy projects. Finally, Shree Cement faces a GST demand order of Rs 41.1 crore related to valuation and excess ITC claimed, which could affect its financials.

items.title: UCO Bank, IoB, Central Bank, Punjab & Sind Bank shares surge up to 4% on stake sale reports
items.description: According to reports, the Department of Investment and Public Asset Management has invited bids from merchant bankers to facilitate the government’s proposed stake sale in public sector banks

items.title: Bernstein bullish on Zomato despite rising quick-commerce competition, says shares can rally to Rs 310
items.description: Bernstein noted that competition in quick commerce is a key debate, driven by aggressive expansion and marketing spends across Zomato, Swiggy, and Zepto.

items.title: Agri Picks Report February 25, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The International Grains Council has scaled down its estimate for global production in 2024-25 by 3 million tonnes to 2,301 million tonnes, compared to its projections in January, according to a grain market report released Thursday.

items.title: Repco Home Finance: Focused on affordable housing loans, undervalued
items.description: Core portfolio growth, geographical diversification will drive scale

items.title: Akzo Nobel India shares in focus on selling powder coatings business and R&D centre to parent entity
items.description: Akzo Nobel India received a binding offer from parent Akzo Nobel N.V. for the sale of its powder coatings business and R&D Centre.

items.title: JPMorgan sees value in defence stocks after sharp fall, remains bullish on growth
items.description: JPMorgan analysts remain confident in the structural growth story of defence stocks, emphasising that India's defence capex and domestic manufacturing push are long-term trends

items.title: SBI Card shares slip as it trades ex-divided; Morgan Stanley reiterates "equal-weight" rating
items.description: SBI Card's market presence strengthened in January, with its market share climbing to 15.7 percent

items.title: Hong Kong, Asian stocks drop as US pressures China
items.description: Equity indexes in Hong Kong and mainland China dropped at the open and a regional gauge of shares fell for a second consecutive day.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty above 22,550, Sensex up 200 pts; M&M, TCS, Zomato most active
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: On the sectoral front, buying is seen in the auto, Consumer Durables, FMCG, telecom, while selling is seen in the IT, metal, oil & gas, metal, energy, capital goods,  pharma. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices down 0.5 percent each. M&M, HDFC Bank, TCS, BSE Limited, Tata Investment among most active shares on the NSE.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Biocon, Texmaco Rail, NTPC Green Energy, UPL, SpiceJet in focus on 25 February
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Feb 25: Stocks like Welspun Corp, SBI Life Insurance Company, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation, NTPC, Waterbase, Shree Cement, Refex Industries, Nazara Technologies, Life Insurance Corporation of India, KEI Industries, Dipna Pharmachem, and Kisan Mouldings will be in focus on February 25.

items.title: US Markets Edge Higher; S&P 500 up 0.13%, Dow Gains 0.53%
items.description: Warren Buffett’s, Berkshire Hathaway's Class A shares jump nearly 4 percent after posting strong earnings.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Cummins India, NTPC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Avanti Feeds, Berger Paints, and others on February 25?
items.description: The index is expected to extend its southward move in the upcoming sessions, given the negative sentiment. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.
